docs.lead_paragraph: About 20 aides are dedicated to building a social media presence in the president’s own voice to help develop a more personal rapport on multiple platforms.
docs.snippet: About 20 aides are dedicated to building a social media presence in the president’s own voice to help develop a more personal rapport on multiple platforms....
docs.abstract: White House Letter; Pres Obama's dedicated social media team works to construct felicitous presence on several popular platforms; effort is crucial facet of Obama's trailblazing use of digital media in his campaigns and administration.

headline.main: A Digital Team Is Helping Obama Find His Voice Online

docs.lead_paragraph: As Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel arrives at the White House on Monday, he and President Obama have reasons to put the past behind them.

byline.contributor: Peter Baker reported from Washington, and Jodi Rudoren from Jerusalem.
byline.original: By PETER BAKER and JODI RUDOREN

docs.snippet: As Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel arrives at the White House on Monday, he and President Obama have reasons to put the past behind them....
docs.abstract: Israeli Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu and Pres Obama's first meeting in over a year offers ample reason to forge new rapport as men discuss matters of high priority, but past slights and misunderstandings are likely to leave relationship cool; differing opinions on issues including Palestinian territories, Iran and American-Israeli relationship have contributed to tensions.

headline.print_headline: With U.S. and Israel, It’s Who Slighted Whom
headline.main: Obama and Netanyahu: A Story of Slights and Crossed Signals

docs.lead_paragraph: Jeb Bush, Chris Christie and John R. Kasich are trying to climb their way back in the presidential race by winning over voters with personal encounters in small towns, schools and senior centers.
docs.snippet: Jeb Bush, Chris Christie and John R. Kasich are trying to climb their way back in the presidential race by winning over voters with personal encounters in small towns, schools and senior centers....
docs.abstract: Republican presidential candidates Jeb Bush, Chris Christie and John Kasich, all of whom are trailing in polls, are staking their fortunes on face-to-face encounters in New Hampshire, long thought to influence direction of race; idea is coming into question in competition dominated by social media and televised debates between large field of contenders.

headline.print_headline: Weak in Polls and Betting All on 1 State
headline.main: G.O.P. Candidates, Lagging, Rely on New Hampshire to Get Close
